posts.post_content: What the hell was Wizards thinking with all of these kamikaze Legends? The whole point of the legend rule is so that you *don't* end up playing multiple copies of powerful critters. Great design space though.

Posted By: stygimoloch (5/1/2009 2:19:46 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Time for a design story!  
  
As Aaron Forsythe recounts (http://www.wizards.com/Magic/Magazine/Article.aspx?x=mtgcom/daily/af38); the spirit dragon cycle were costed according to how typical it was for dragons to show up in those colors.  
So [red](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=79242) and [blue](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=75286) were the most splashable, [Yosei](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=78590) and Cocopuffs less so, and [Jugan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=50247) the least so.
posts.html:
Time for a design story!

As Aaron Forsythe recounts (http://www.wizards.com/Magic/Magazine/Article.aspx?x=mtgcom/daily/af38); the spirit dragon cycle were costed according to how typical it was for dragons to show up in those colors.
So red and blue were the most splashable, Yosei and Cocopuffs less so, and Jugan the least so.

Posted By: YTK (2/19/2009 6:56:37 PM)
Rating:

This was one of the creatures that got me back on the idea of Recurring Nightmare. Run two of them and cycle back and forth. Especially fun if you happen to get Gisela, Blade of Goldnight. Eliminate an entire group in multi-player in one swoop. Ba-BOOM!

@DarthParallax; It's weird; I would never think to play him like that. I'm putting him in my deck TOO combo him in multi-player; On top of my above comment is a Living Death with 2 of him in the graveyard and Gisela. As they have to come into play for the legend rule to apply, Gisela would also be in play; therefore when they both die due to legend ruling each one will deal 10 damage to each of my opponents; if no one has gained life that's game. Possibly by turn 3...can't wait.

I'm not criticising you; I do see some appeal in leaving him there as a threat. No one want's to kill him, which is always fun...then again I have friends who play with Swords ... (see all)

Posted By: RecurringMemories (11/2/2012 3:58:17 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
His ability is SO extremely powerful in muliplayer, that I choose to run him with some self-imposed restrictions:  
  
Use him like a Flying [Craw Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Craw Wurm). Just cast him, and start attacking people with it. Dare them to block it and 'bite the poisoned apple'. Attack evenly, so you aren't screwing people too bad. Explain that if you didn't attack SOMEbody every turn, you would have him up to chump block with, and you don't want that temptation. Don't build your deck around him, don't try to make him go off. Leave that up to your opponents to do for you, and if people start trying to exile him, next game use him Spikier to teach them not to do that anymore. So they can choose to either take an incidental 5 in the air, or they can set off a Spirit Bomb of Life Point exchanging that leaves not many non-you people a chance to win. :D  
  
  
PURE. EVIL. !!! :D   
  
Just have him be that Awful Tension Card in your deck, but set things so that they only have themselves to blame if he actu... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
His ability is SO extremely powerful in muliplayer, that I choose to run him with some self-imposed restrictions:

Use him like a Flying Craw Wurm. Just cast him, and start attacking people with it. Dare them to block it and 'bite the poisoned apple'. Attack evenly, so you aren't screwing people too bad. Explain that if you didn't attack SOMEbody every turn, you would have him up to chump block with, and you don't want that temptation. Don't build your deck around him, don't try to make him go off. Leave that up to your opponents to do for you, and if people start trying to exile him, next game use him Spikier to teach them not to do that anymore. So they can choose to either take an incidental 5 in the air, or they can set off a Spirit Bomb of Life Point exchanging that leaves not many non-you people a chance to win. :D
